starter.description: the current definition of the starter: may change during multi-step starters

status.title: Status
status.description: the current state of the Starter

name.description: the canonical name of the starter

body.description: user data populated by the client

path.description: the API path (`/` delimited) to which files will be written

copy.description: copy files after starter is run (irrespective of status) if `true`

errors.description: a listing of system and user errors created during a starter

label.title: Label
label.description: human-readable, plain-text description used in UI labels and tab titles

description.title: Description
description.description: short, plain-text description of the intent of the Starter

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) string to use in Launcher cards and tab icons

commands.title: Commands
commands.description: [JupyterLab commands](https://jupyterlab.readthedocs.io/en/stable/developer/extension_points.html#commands) to run after the Starter has completed

ignore.title: Ignore Files
ignore.description: [glob-style patterns](https://docs.python.org/3/library/pathlib.html#pathlib.PurePath.match) for folders and files exclude from copying, with * for wildcards

schema.title: JSON Schema
schema.description: [Draft 7 JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema) that generates a form like this one, which must validate the user's data. Description fields may include markdown

uiSchema.title: UI Schema
uiSchema.description: [react-jsonschema-form `uiSchema`](https://react-jsonschema-form.readthedocs.io/en/latest/form-customization/#the-uischema-object) for customizing the selection of widgets

args.title: Arguments
args.description: optional values provided to the command when executed

dest.description: A name to copy to: Jinja will be applied with `body` as the context

starter-notebook.title: Notebook Starter
starter-notebook.description: Uses a notebook as both the configuration object (in `#/metadata/jupyter-starters`) and execution

starter-python.title: Python Starter
starter-python.description: Invokes an importable python function (multiple times)

callable.description: a python function that accepts the `body`

starter-src.description: path to the starter. may be absolute or relative to the `notebook` launch directory (or `py_src`)

starter-py-src.description: name of a python module installed in the `notebook` environment to prepent to `src`
